title: A Pastoral Landscape with a Shepherd
medium: pen and ink, grey and brown washes
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Jean Jacques de Boissieu [1736-1810]. Anonymous collection (Lugt 994a), possibly J. F. Frauenholz [1758-1822], Nuremberg, Germany [1]. Seiferheld-Selz Fine Arts, Inc., New York, NY [2]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 [3]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. Anonymous collector's mark Lugt 994a (recto, lower left.) J. F. Frauenholz as per label on mount; see note [2] below. According to Lugt, J. F. Frauenholz published etchings by de Boissieu.
[2]. Seiferheld-Selz Fine Arts, Inc. label on mount. Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through the Seiferheld gallery in NYC, which was active throughout the 1960s under various names.
[3]. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute in June 1974; see curatorial file for original loan form and list of works.
